briefdescription.para: This function obtains read pointers of the tty.

parameterdescription.para: The tty where the function obtain the pointers
The position of the pointer where it is reading
The col position of the stdout where it is reading
The row position of the stdout where it is reading

The row position of the stdout where it is writting

memberdef.argsstring: (tty_t tty, int readPointer, int readCol, int readRow)

briefdescription.para: This function saves the reads pointers of the tty that is indicated in the signature. This function is called when change the tty that is in focus, so it has to backup it's pointer.

parameterdescription.para: The tty where the function save the pointers
The position of the pointer where it is reading
The col position of the stdout where it is reading
The row position of the stdout where it is reading

memberdef.argsstring: (tty_t tty, int writePointer, int writeCol, int writeRow)
memberdef.name: setWritePointer

briefdescription.para: This function saves the reads pointers of the tty that is indicated in the signature. This function is called when change the tty who is in focus, so it has to backup his pointer.

parameterdescription.para: The tty where the function save the pointers
The position of the pointer where it is writting
The col position of the stdout where it is writting
The row position of the stdout where it is writting

briefdescription.para: This function prints a string in a specific tty. It checks if it has to print only in the tty or in stdin too. It called to putCharTTy while the length of the string was grater than 0.

detaileddescription.para:
name
The string to print
count
The size of the string
tty
The tty id where has to be printed the string
Use: char*string="test"; ... putsTTY(string); ...

briefdescription.para: It prints only one character in specific tty. It verifies if the character is a control key or it belongs to the ASCII table. It checks if the tty is what are in focus, so it has to put the character in stdin buffer.

detaileddescription.para:
c
The chacter to be printed
tty
The tty id where has to be printed
inStdIn
If it has to print in Stdin or not
Use: char*string="System"; while(*string!=NULL) putCharTTY(*string++,tty,(TRUEvFALSE)):

briefdescription.para: Create the table of ttys. The maximum of ttys is a define.
This function returns the tty id of tty that are in focus at this moment. It is a system called.

This function changes the tty focus id on the next Tty that has to be in focus. This function is called when the key that was pressed is between "F1" and "F7". Of every "F" key that was pressed, is put a value between 0x81 and 0x87. The number of the "F" key + 0x80.
Pust all of character that are in the STDOUT and and puts in the tty STDOUT who is in focus.

Leaves all of character that are in the KeyboradBuffer and put in the correct tty stdout if the tty mode is CANONICAL, if not it prints directly in the STDIN of tty who is in focus. The timet tick is the responsible to call this function.
This functions check if the proccess if different of init and the running process has a valid pid, it only refreshes the stdout.
Sets the pid to the process which is in focus.

parameterdescription.para: The pid of the process
The tty where will be set the pid of the process

briefdescription.para: Returns the pid of the process that is in this tty.

parameterdescription.para: The tty where it is saved the pid of the focus process

briefdescription.para: It clears the stdout of the tty that is in focus.
It sets the cursor in an specific position of the tty stdout.

parameterdescription.para: The row of the stdout
The column of the stdout

briefdescription.para: It puts a character in a specific position of the tty stdout. It prints the character at the position but it keeps the previous position.

parameterdescription.para: The character to be printed
The row where has to be printed
The column where has to be printed

simplesect.para: Luciano Zemin, Nicolás Magni, Nicolás Purita
